intro: Tieghemella africana, commonly known as African yellowwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, berry-like fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
